confession.seduction_context: She was very unhappy and angry at being called witch when she was not one; she agreed to believe in him 'fort legerement' (very lightly)

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused's piglets entered witness's garden; wife chased three piglets out and accused claimed one was injured
testimony.threat_quote: mal joye et santé puisse elle accoucher
mal joye et santé puisse elle accoucher

testimony.quarrel_subject: In 1610 when husband was doyen, required to 'guager' (seize property from) accused's husband
testimony.threat_quote: que soub ledit pont puisse il estre noyé

testimony.quarrel_subject: Wolf took accused's pig while witness's children Jean and Idatte were guarding pigs; Jean replied that perhaps accused had taken it herself
testimony.threat_quote: she would remember this and he would repent
que le Diable l'avoit ja bien apporté, mais qu'il ne viveroit guiere

testimony.quarrel_subject: piece of loom broke when weaving accused's cloth; she was angry

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after she watched him at loom

testimony.quarrel_subject: Nicolle (accused's daughter) told off witness's daughter for fishing in stream outside accused's house without being asked
Jennon (witness's sister-in-law) quarreled with accused; accused called her 'ribaude', she replied 'sorciere'

harms_alleged.target: Jennon wife of Mongeon Robert (witness's sister-in-law)

witnesses.name: Claude Mourchat
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: relative by marriage (his late uncle Colas Hannel married accused's mother)

testimony.quarrel_subject: witness prohibited accused from being invited to celebration after his wife had a child, on account of reputation
testimony.threat_quote: que jamais elle ne l'aymeroit, et qu'au lieu qu'il la debvoit supporter comme son parent

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over pasture with witness's sister Epnon
neighbors warned witness that accused was having affair with witness's husband; also dispute over damage by accused's pig in witness's garden
told accused that 'la Sarasine' had identified her as witch who caused illness
accused of accused of stealing hatband he had dropped
assisted doyen Demenge Curien to 'guager' (seize property from) accused's husband, taking a cart
testimony.threat_quote: qu'ilz puissent avoir ledit char deans le ventre

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel when he wanted to move out; accused falsely accused him of attempted rape
first husband Jean Husson was Doyen at Moyenmoutier and obliged to 'guager' accused's husband
accompanied Jean Husson when 'guaging' accused's husband; accused especially angry they took a cauldron
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il avoit encore des enfans bien jeunes, mais que de sa part il n'y iroit plus guiere

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Nicolas Johel declared himself partie formelle and made himself liable for costs

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Initial interrogation with resolute denials; followed by confrontations with witnesses

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews then racked; confessed after being racked twice

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions; retracted accusations against two women saying could not maintain them with certainty

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

timeline.subject: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
timeline.details: Sentence carried out at St Dié

accomplices_named.name: Babellon femme Mongeon Voirin
accomplices_named.context: Thought she recognized by speech and clothes at sabbat (masked)

accomplices_named.name: Catherine femme Jean le Maire le Jeune
accomplices_named.context: Thought she recognized by speech and clothes at sabbat (masked)

prior_accusations.context: Mother previously convicted and executed as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
notable_quotes.french: mal joye et santé puisse elle accoucher
notable_quotes.english: may she give birth in ill joy and health
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Beniste femme Anthoine Robert after piglets incident

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel
notable_quotes.french: que soub ledit pont puisse il estre noyé
notable_quotes.english: may he be drowned under that bridge
notable_quotes.context: After property was recovered that had been seized from her husband; directed at doyen Demenge Surien who subsequently drowned

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon la Bolle
notable_quotes.french: Sorciere qu'a tu affaire de menacer mes gens et d'ainsy faire de ma fille
notable_quotes.english: Witch, what business do you have threatening my people and thus affecting my daughter
notable_quotes.context: To accused after his daughter developed swollen neck following cat attack

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean La Bolle
notable_quotes.french: que peut estre c'estoit elle, ou le maling qui l'a tanté, qui l'avoit esté prendre en forme dudit Loup
notable_quotes.english: that perhaps it was her, or the devil who tempted her, who had taken it in the form of said wolf
notable_quotes.context: Suggesting accused or devil in wolf form took the pig

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte's daughter (victim)
notable_quotes.french: se jectant ca et la la teste enbas, ce que denotoit ladite maladie n'estre ordinaire
notable_quotes.english: throwing herself here and there head down, which showed the said illness was not ordinary
notable_quotes.context: Description of strange illness before death

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Mourchat to accused
notable_quotes.french: que jamais elle ne l'aymeroit, et qu'au lieu qu'il la debvoit supporter comme son parent
notable_quotes.english: that she would never love him, and that instead he should support her as his relative
notable_quotes.context: Accused's response to being excluded from childbirth celebration due to reputation

notable_quotes.speaker: Sarasine (cunning woman)
notable_quotes.french: une certaine Sarasine que celle qu'avoit donné la maladie a sadite femme estoit toict a toict de sa maison, et que pour ung teston elle la feroit venir promptement
notable_quotes.english: a certain Sarasine said that the one who had given the illness to his wife was roof to roof with his house, and that for a teston she would make her come promptly
notable_quotes.context: Sarasine identifying accused as witch who caused Jennon's illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Thonnere
notable_quotes.french: qu'ilz puissent avoir ledit char deans le ventre
notable_quotes.english: may they have the said cart in their belly
notable_quotes.context: Accused's curse when officials seized cart from her husband

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: femme de bien, et sy desiroient de la faire dampner
notable_quotes.english: good woman, and they desired to damn her
notable_quotes.context: Response when asked to confess under torture

relationships.evidence_text: Mongeatte femme Jean Johel de Moyenmoutier
Father was Nicolas Hannel of St. Remy, ban d'Etival
mother Marguitte, who came from Basin, executed as a witch
witness 1 and witness 2 identified as husband and wife
Jennon, wife of her late brother Mongeon Robert
His late uncle Colas Hannel had married her mother
His late uncle Colas Hannel had married her mother
qu'au lieu qu'il la debvoit supporter comme son parent - his uncle married accused's mother
she had been in service of accused 12 years earlier

economic_context.details: Multiple witnesses described 'guaging' (property seizure) from accused's husband by various doyens (village officials), suggesting financial difficulties. Accused's husband was a verrier (glassmaker). Accused described herself as poor ('she was poor and had children'). Property seized included cart, cauldron, and other household items.

harms_catalog.harm_description: drowned in river

harms_catalog.harm_description: strange illness, throwing herself about head down, died after 4 days

harms_catalog.harm_description: pregnant, fell down in street and died suddenly without saying a word
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel where accused called victim 'ribaude', victim replied 'sorciere'

harms_catalog.harm_description: strange malady, ill only 15 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: related to death of his wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell down and had to be killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: same as above

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 3 weeks, as if 'frenetique' (frenzied)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: witness prohibited accused from being invited to childbirth celebration due to reputation

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill and died; accused offered fish before death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over pasture

harms_catalog.harm_description: unable to walk, died after a month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused walked rapidly past witness without saying anything (after rumors of affair with witness's husband)

harms_catalog.harm_description: fever, became all swollen, died after a month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over damage done by accused's pig in witness's garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: millwheel broke into pieces (had been rebuilt only fortnight before)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: minor quarrel at mill

harms_catalog.harm_description: child died soon after
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: small daughter sent to buy apples, sent them back as not worth price

harms_catalog.harm_description: taken by wind and thrown in river, nearly drowned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused her of stealing hatband he had dropped

harms_catalog.harm_description: strange illness, bedridden more than 4 months, everyone judged him moribund
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: assisted doyen to 'guager' her husband, taking cart
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curse/witchcraft, recovered after confrontation with accused's husband

harms_catalog.harm_description: hailed for an hour
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: none
harms_catalog.method_alleged: beating river with small white wand at 11 at night

harms_catalog.harm_description: very ill for 22 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel when he wanted to move out; accused falsely accused him of attempted rape so he was imprisoned
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft, recovered after she visited and he denied suspecting her

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill so everyone said he was bewitched, died after 15 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: as Doyen obliged to 'guager' accused's husband

small pig belonging to accused taken by wolf; also pig owned by accused damaged witness's garden
multiple cows mentioned as victims of witchcraft or dying after quarrels

Jean La Bolle's weaving loom, piece broke while weaving accused's cloth
seized by doyen from accused's husband during 'guaging' (property seizure)
seized during 'guaging' of accused's husband; accused especially angry about this
Colas Marchal dropped hatband, accused her of stealing it
forgeron's daughter sent to buy apples from accused
accused offered to send fish to dying Epnon
broke into pieces after quarrel at mill
accused seen beating river with small white wand at night before hailstorm
greased by devil, used to fly to sabbat up chimney (confession)
gave master a hen around every St Martin to be excused from sabbat (confession)
cunning woman Sarasine said for a teston she would make witch come

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused and most witnesses
Where accused's father Nicolas Hannel was from
Where accused's mother Marguitte came from
Claudon la Bolle was working at Raon
Jean Husson (son) went to war in Germany
Where witness Pauline femme Jean du Train lived
Where Catherine femme Jean le Maire le Jeune (named accomplice) lived
Francois de Beze was sent to Nancy as messenger; Change de Nancy was appellate court
Demenge Surien drowned in river; accused seen beating river with wand; Colas Marchal thrown in river by wind
Accused said 'may he be drowned under that bridge' about Demenge Surien
Stream outside accused's house where girls were fishing
Site of quarrels and property damage (millwheel)
Sr Jean Godard kept a forge 12 years before
Colas Marchal was returning from St Blaise when thrown in river

historical_context.military_details: Jean Husson (son of Barthelemin Husson) went to war in Germany and died 2 days after return
weather_events: hailstorm lasting an hour after accused seen beating river with white wand
animal_predation: wolf appeared and took small pig belonging to accused
economic_hardship_indicators: accused described herself as poor with children
multiple property seizures ('guaging') from accused's husband due to debts
accused refused at sabbat to spoil crops because 'she was poor and had children'
religious_calendar_references: St Martin (confession: gave devil hen around every St Martin)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Accused falsely accused Claudon Francois of attempted rape when he wanted to move out of her house, resulting in his imprisonment

legal_context.redress_outcome: Husband made private settlements ('accordes soubs main') with Jean Bertrand and Demenge Voirin when they called wife witch, without going to court

hearsay_chains.content: told she had said about his son 'que le Diable l'avoit ja bien apporté, mais qu'il ne viveroit guiere'
later heard that after recovering property she had been near bridge and said curse
told that witch who gave illness to wife was roof to roof with house
heard from husband that accused absented herself on hearing rumor of arrest
neighbors warned her that accused was having affair with her husband
wife told witness with tears that she blamed death of daughter on accused

emotional_state_notes: fairly resolute denials during initial interrogation
said she was 'femme de bien' (good woman) under torture
repeated she never wished to do harm, was 'estrangement sollicitée' (strongly pressed) by her master

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said that Beniste femme Anthoine Robert was a thief, but could only allege hearsay
Said she would have liked to beat Claudatte wife of Colas Valtin over suspicions of affair with husband, if she had been strong enough - charge was untrue

third_parties.name: Nicolle (daughter of accused)
third_parties.context: Told off Claudatte (witness 7's daughter) for fishing in stream outside house

third_parties.name: Jean (son of Claudon la Bolle)
third_parties.context: Was guarding pigs when wolf took accused's pig

third_parties.name: Sarasine (cunning woman)
third_parties.context: Identified accused as witch causing Jennon's illness; offered to make her come for a teston

third_parties.name: wife of forgeron mre Chrestofle
third_parties.context: Blamed accused for daughter's death; openly called her witch

third_parties.name: Jean Bertrand
third_parties.context: Called accused witch; husband made private settlement without going to court

third_parties.name: Demenge Voirin
third_parties.context: Called accused witch; husband made private settlement without going to court

extraction_metadata.notes: Very thorough trial record with 21 witnesses and detailed testimony. Mother's execution established precedent. Economic factors prominent: multiple property seizures from accused's husband suggest financial difficulties. Cunning woman 'Sarasine' mentioned as counter-magic practitioner. Accused's confession emphasized coercion by devil and reluctance to harm ('never wished to do harm'). Notable that accused refused at sabbat to spoil crops 'because she was poor and had children.' Weather magic witnessed (beating river with wand before hailstorm). Pattern of harms following quarrels very consistent across witnesses. Several witnesses noted recovery after accused visited or confrontation occurred. Reputation duration: 18 years since marriage. The execution location (St Dié) differs from trial location (Moyenmoutier). Notable: witness 18 (Francois de Beze) saw weather magic firsthand and publicly called her witch without legal consequences.
